<a id="PhysicsBody3D"></a>

# PhysicsBody3D

**Inherits:** [CollisionObject3D](CollisionObject3D.md) **\<** [Node3D](Node3D.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [CharacterBody3D](CharacterBody3D.md), [PhysicalBone3D](PhysicalBone3D.md), [RigidBody3D](RigidBody3D.md), [StaticBody3D](StaticBody3D.md)

Abstract base class for 3D game objects affected by physics.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**PhysicsBody3D** is an abstract base class for 3D game objects affected by physics. All 3D physics bodies inherit from it.

\ **Warning:** With a non-uniform scale, this node will likely not behave as expected. It is advised to keep its scale the same on all axes and adjust its collision shape(s) instead.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Physics introduction](../tutorials/physics/physics_introduction.md)

- [Troubleshooting physics issues](../tutorials/physics/troubleshooting_physics_issues.md)

## Method Descriptions

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_add_collision_exception_with"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_collision_exception_with**\ (\ body\: [Node](Node.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_add_collision_exception_with)

Adds a body to the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_get_axis_lock"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **get_axis_lock**\ (\ axis\: [BodyAxis](PhysicsServer3D.md#enum_PhysicsServer3D_BodyAxis)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_get_axis_lock)

Returns ``true`` if the specified linear or rotational `axis` is locked.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_get_collision_exceptions"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[PhysicsBody3D](PhysicsBody3D.md)\] **get_collision_exceptions**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_get_collision_exceptions)

Returns an array of nodes that were added as collision exceptions for this body.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_get_gravity"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector3](Vector3.md) **get_gravity**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_get_gravity)

Returns the gravity vector computed from all sources that can affect the body, including all gravity overrides from [Area3D](Area3D.md) nodes and the global world gravity.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_move_and_collide"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[KinematicCollision3D](KinematicCollision3D.md) **move_and_collide**\ (\ motion\: [Vector3](Vector3.md), test_only\: [bool](bool.md) = false, safe_margin\: [float](float.md) = 0.001, recovery_as_collision\: [bool](bool.md) = false, max_collisions\: [int](int.md) = 1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_move_and_collide)

Moves the body along the vector `motion`. In order to be frame rate independent in [Node._physics_process()](Node.md#Node_private_method__physics_process) or [Node._process()](Node.md#Node_private_method__process), `motion` should be computed using ``delta``.

The body will stop if it collides. Returns a [KinematicCollision3D](KinematicCollision3D.md), which contains information about the collision when stopped, or when touching another body along the motion.

If `test_only` is ``true``, the body does not move but the would-be collision information is given.

\ `safe_margin` is the extra margin used for collision recovery (see [CharacterBody3D.safe_margin](CharacterBody3D.md#CharacterBody3D_property_safe_margin) for more details).

If `recovery_as_collision` is ``true``, any depenetration from the recovery phase is also reported as a collision; this is used e.g. by [CharacterBody3D](CharacterBody3D.md) for improving floor detection during floor snapping.

\ `max_collisions` allows to retrieve more than one collision result.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_remove_collision_exception_with"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **remove_collision_exception_with**\ (\ body\: [Node](Node.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_remove_collision_exception_with)

Removes a body from the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_set_axis_lock"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_axis_lock**\ (\ axis\: [BodyAxis](PhysicsServer3D.md#enum_PhysicsServer3D_BodyAxis), lock\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_set_axis_lock)

Locks or unlocks the specified linear or rotational `axis` depending on the value of `lock`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsBody3D_method_test_move"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **test_move**\ (\ from\: [Transform3D](Transform3D.md), motion\: [Vector3](Vector3.md), collision\: [KinematicCollision3D](KinematicCollision3D.md) = null, safe_margin\: [float](float.md) = 0.001, recovery_as_collision\: [bool](bool.md) = false, max_collisions\: [int](int.md) = 1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsBody3D_method_test_move)

Checks for collisions without moving the body. In order to be frame rate independent in [Node._physics_process()](Node.md#Node_private_method__physics_process) or [Node._process()](Node.md#Node_private_method__process), `motion` should be computed using ``delta``.

Virtually sets the node's position, scale and rotation to that of the given [Transform3D](Transform3D.md), then tries to move the body along the vector `motion`. Returns ``true`` if a collision would stop the body from moving along the whole path.

\ `collision` is an optional object of type [KinematicCollision3D](KinematicCollision3D.md), which contains additional information about the collision when stopped, or when touching another body along the motion.

\ `safe_margin` is the extra margin used for collision recovery (see [CharacterBody3D.safe_margin](CharacterBody3D.md#CharacterBody3D_property_safe_margin) for more details).

If `recovery_as_collision` is ``true``, any depenetration from the recovery phase is also reported as a collision; this is useful for checking whether the body would *touch* any other bodies.

\ `max_collisions` allows to retrieve more than one collision result.
